other_tests.findings: Blood level of lithium was 0.9 meq/liter initially and decreased to 0.6 meq/liter with a dosage of 600 mg b.i.d.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The patient responded well to treatment initially, experiencing remission of acute symptoms; however, over time, severe depressive episodes and rapid cycling occurred.

other_tests.findings: The patient was experiencing rapid cycling of mood, characterized by mild hypomanic and depressive episodes.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The pattern of mood cycling became more pronounced with introduction of new antidepressant medications, leading to increased frequency of interspersed depressive episodes.

other_tests.findings: Divalproex was added at a dose of 1000 mg h.s., yielding a blood level of 70 mg/liter.
other_tests.changes_over_time: This combination resulted in a pattern of mood cycling with mild hypomanic and depressive symptoms persisting.

other_tests.findings: Lamotrigine was added at a dose of 200 mg/day, resulting in a reduction of depressive symptoms to intermittent, brief episodes.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Following the addition of lamotrigine, the patient experienced an improvement in mood symptoms but continued cycling.
